page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.HUNTINGDON.
page.content:
Huntingdon, once the County town of Huntingdonshire is an administrative District of Cambridgeshire,and rich in historical evidence.From a small market town in the first half of the twentieth century it had a large housing estate built to house people moving from London in the sixty's.The population,some 19,000 people,is served by an elected town council in addition to District and County councils.Industrial estates house a range of light industries,and a frequent rail service takes commuters to London.There is a mixture of old and new housing.
.
